title: L'Enchanteur
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Beal
provenance_text:
Gustave Singier [1909-1984], Paris, France; Galerie de France, Paris, France [1]; Mr. [1898-1987] and Mrs. [1898-1993] James H. Beal, Pittsburgh, PA, November 1955 until February 1977 [1]; their gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, February 1977.

Notes:
[1]. The painting was no. 273 (illustrated, plate 102) in "The 1955 Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Contemporary Painting" held at Carnegie Institute, October-December 1955. It was lent by Galerie de France. 
[2]. Mrs. Beal purchased the painting from the International for $2000 on November 15, 1955.
